meanings.sent1: The heritrix inherited the family estate.
meanings.sent2: The heritrix was next in line to receive the ancestral home.
meanings.sent3: The heritrix was thrilled to learn she had inherited a fortune from her great aunt.
meanings.sent4: She stood proudly, like a heritrix of old, ready to take on her responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The heritrix's presence in the grand hall signaled the passing of power from one generation to the next.

meanings.definition: A woman who inherits or is entitled to inherit property.
meanings.sent1: The heritrix received the deed to the family farm.
meanings.sent2: As the heritrix, she was the rightful owner of the valuable paintings.
meanings.sent3: The heritrix was surprised to find out she had inherited a collection of rare books.
meanings.sent4: She carried herself with the grace and dignity befitting a heritrix of great wealth.
meanings.sent5: The heritrix's name was now synonymous with wealth and privilege in the town.
